examples.description: a new person is instantiated with a name
examples.full_description: Person instantiation ::new a new person is instantiated with a name

examples.description: a new person knows its name once he/she has been initialized
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #name a new person knows its name once he/she has been initialized

examples.description: a new person instance cannot overwrite the name it was instantied with
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #name a new person instance cannot overwrite the name it was instantied with

examples.description: a new person instance is initialized with a bank_account balance of $25
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #bank_account a new person instance is initialized with a bank_account balance of $25

examples.description: a person instance can change his/her bank_account amount
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #bank_account a person instance can change his/her bank_account amount

examples.description: a new person instance is initialized with a happiness index of 8
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #happiness  a new person instance is initialized with a happiness index of 8

examples.description: a person instance can change his/her happiness index
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #happiness a person instance can change his/her happiness index

examples.description: a person's happiness doesn't exceed 10
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #happiness a person's happiness doesn't exceed 10

examples.description: a person's happiness doesn't go below 0
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #happiness a person's happiness doesn't go below 0

examples.description: a person instance is initialized with a hygiene index of 8
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #hygiene a person instance is initialized with a hygiene index of 8

examples.description: a person instance can change its hygiene index
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #hygiene a person instance can change its hygiene index

examples.description: a person instance's hygiene index cannot exceed 10
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #hygiene a person instance's hygiene index cannot exceed 10

examples.description: a person instance hygiene index cannot be less than 0
examples.full_description: Person instantiation #initialize #hygiene  a person instance hygiene index cannot be less than 0

examples.description: returns true if happiness is greater than seven, else false
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #happy? returns true if happiness is greater than seven, else false

examples.description: returns true if hygiene is greater than seven, else false
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #clean? returns true if hygiene is greater than seven, else false

examples.description: accepts an argument of salary
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #get_paid accepts an argument of salary

examples.description: increments bank_account by the salary
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #get_paid increments bank_account by the salary

examples.description: returns 'all about the benjamins'
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #get_paid returns 'all about the benjamins'

examples.description: makes the person cleaner by 4 points
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #take_bath makes the person cleaner by 4 points

examples.description: can't make a person cleaner by 10 points (hint: use the custom #hygiene= method)
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #take_bath can't make a person cleaner by 10 points (hint: use the custom #hygiene= method)

examples.description: calls on the #hygiene= method to increment hygiene
examples.full_description: Person non-attribute instance methods #take_bath calls on the #hygiene= method to increment hygiene

exception.message:
(#<Person:0x007f9ed8293d48 @name="Penelope", @bank_account=25, @happiness=8, @hygiene=13>).hygiene=(13)
    expected: 1 time with arguments: (13)
    received: 0 times
